conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the movement of the square conductor frame through the magnetic field and determine the time of induced current.
The image shows a square conductor frame with side length \( l \) moving from left to right through a magnetic field. The width of the magnetic field is \( d \), and the frame's speed is \( v \).
The square conductor frame moves uniformly through the magnetic field. The induced current occurs only while the frame is within the magnetic field.
The frame enters the magnetic field on the left side and exits on the right side.
The time it takes for the frame to move from the left side to the right side is determined by its speed and the width of the magnetic field.
The time \( t \) can be calculated using the formula \( t = \frac{d}{v} \).
Since the frame is within the magnetic field only during this time, the induced current is present for \( t = \frac{d}{v} \).
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is \( \frac{d}{v} \).
